label: Petition from Elisabeth Dayley and Jennett Edenher to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Elisabeth Dayley and Jennett Edenher to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, explaining that they expect to be evicted from their residence and that they have nowhere to live.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Elisabeth Dayley and Jennett Edenher to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, explaining that they expect to be evicted from their residence and that they have nowhere to live.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
with papers of 1772 [written in corner of paper in pencil at later date]

To the Gentlemen of St. Andrews Society the Humble Petition of us most Humbley [humbly]	 Sheweth that your petitioners are in verey [very] Grate [great] want of Everey [every] nesesetey [necessity] of Life therefore most Humbley hope your well known Clemencey will extend toward us and find us some Releeif [relief] according as your honours shall so Convient our Residence is at the Hew Baracks at present but Expect to be turned everey Day therefore humbley hope you will pittey [pity] our deplorable Condition we haveing [having] neither house home nor habitation to Go to and your petitioners as in Dutey Bound Shall Every pray

Elisabeth Dayley x
Jennett Edenher x

metadata.label: Collection Title
metadata.value: St. Andrew's Society of Charleston Records, 1729-2001
